He has previously led NMP investments such as Firethorn (acquired by Qualcomm), Employease (acquired by ADP), Synchrologic (acquired by Intellisync/Nokia) and Talus (acquired by Manugistics).

Sales Technologies automated complex sales functions for major corporations through the use of the companyâ€™s proprietary software. Chuck oversaw the companyâ€™s development from the inception stage to over $50 million in revenue in eight years, eventually consummating a successful acquisition by Dun & Bradstreet in 1989, after which Chuck continued in the role of CEO for several additional years.

Prior to founding Sales Technologies, Chuck was a management consultant with McKinsey & Company and previously held several marketing and sales management positions with Procter & Gamble. Chuck has held leadership roles in several entrepreneurial organizations, including Chairman of the Technology Association of Georgia and Chairman of the Georgia Tech Forum.
